page.title: 19NEWS AND VIEWS IN TODDINGTON
page.content: Recent{news items}about Toddington may be found in several local papers like The Leader, Luton News, Herald and The Dunstable Gazette. The main story concerns the{Town Hall,}subject of an enquiry to decide its future. Village opinion, backed up by the Parish and District Councils, favours demolishing rather than restoring it. However, the County Council wants it to be repaired hence the Public Enquiry. Three other stories also make regular headlines. One is{vandalism}with many solutions such as police patrols or neighbourhood watch schemes suggested. Another social concern is the{heavy {traffic}from the motorway thundering past the green. There are repeated pleas for a pedestrian crossing. Then there are regular stories about plans to build three hundred{new houses}here a move almost universally unpopular.
